entry.string: The AuthLDAP module allows you to authenticate a user with an LDAP server. The AuthLDAP module forwards the username and password from the login screen to the LDAP server for authentication.

Authentication by AuthLDAP is automatically available once the the AuthLDAP module has been initialized. You must configure XarLDAP before a user will be able to login to Xaraya. To remove AuthLDAP authentication, you must remove the module or disable it in the modify config screen.
From the menu, you have one choice. "Modify Config".
entry.translation: Das Menü bietet die Möglickeit "Konfiguration ändern" an.

entry.string: Modify Config -- From here, you can allow a user that has account information in LDAP to be automatically added to the Xaraya database and allowed to login. You can also setup the synchronization settings for LDAP groups.
Manually Sync Groups -- This will resynchronize the imported LDAP groups. It may be long the first time if you have lots of Xaraya users imported from LDAP, or lots of (sub)groups to import.

To synchronize the groups, we recommand to setup a job entry in the scheduler module. You need to call the function in (module:authldap, type:admin, function:syncgroups). The module has some caching mecanism for LDAP user profiles, so you can run this job frequently, for example every 30 minutes, without fearing about resource usage.
There are no included blocks with the AuthLDAP Module
